meanings.definition: Regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: She idealised her favorite singer, believing he could do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: The movie idealised the concept of true love, making it seem flawless.
meanings.sent3: He idealised his cooking skills, but burnt the dinner every time.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the vacation was idealised, like a painting of paradise.
meanings.sent5: The children idealised their teacher, thinking she had magical powers.

meanings.definition: To make something seem better or more perfect than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement idealised the benefits of the product, exaggerating its effects.
meanings.sent2: She always idealised her achievements, never acknowledging her mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The chef idealised the taste of his soup, but it turned out too salty.
meanings.sent4: His dream idealised the future, painting a picture of success and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The artist idealised the landscape, adding vibrant colors to enhance its beauty.
